# Rule 3 - Keep IC and OOC Seperate
Keep in character interactions in character, and out of character interactions out of character.
## Precedents
- Don't use the OOC or LOOC chat to communicate in character, such as using it to bypass speech restrictions. - Using LOOC to teach someone something that can't be taught in character such as the controls of the game, is fine. - Don't say LOOC or OOC things in character, such as referencing the duration of a round. Stay in character.
